title.narrative: STRENGTHENED RIGHTS GUARANTEE SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2016, the Rights Guarantee System in areas where UNICEF has a presence (urban centres and municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Seal in the Semi-arid and Amazon) is strengthened to implement specific and integrated methodologies to prevent violence and to improve attention to children and families who have their rights violated, including in the context of emergencies, great infrastructure works and sports events., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Human Rights Institutions, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, National Child Rights Guarantee Systems (SGD) is strengthened at national and local level to ensure equitable realization of children's rights, including those living with disabilities, taking into account gender, race and ethnicity dimensions, with a focus on the Semiarid, Amazon and the prioritized urban centres.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, the Rights Guarantee System in areas where UNICEF has a presence (urban centres and municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Sealin the Semi-arid and Amazon) is strengthened to implement specific and integrated methodologies to prevent violence and to improveattention to children and families who have their rights violated, including in the context of emergencies, great infrastructureworks and sports events.

description.narrative: UNICEF and partners used integrated methodologies to train over 750 professionals to prevent violence against children; reached more than 80 million people with protection messages, disseminated the mobile app Protect Brazil app, raised awareness of eight million boys and girls about violence resulting on a strengthened protection system. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of members of guardianship councils in the territories in which UNICEF is active trained by the schools of these councils in operational flows and ethnic and racial issues to promote and protect rights, with a particular focus on indigenous and Quilombola children.

baseline.value: for the PCU, PAM and SAB regions: being surveyed, situation in 2012.

title.narrative: Percentage of professionals (disaggregated by gender, race and ethnic group) of civil defense teams and actors of the SGD system in states and municipalities identified as the most vulnerable to disasters informed about the contents of the National Protocol for integral protection of children and adolescents in disaster situations.

target.value: 2016:60% of all professionals and actors of the SGD system in PCU, SAB and PAM informed about these contents.
